page.title: 15Social Life at Chatsworth
page.content:
There are a number of social activities for people living on the Chatsworth Estate. The Cavendish Club at Edensor is a private club for employees, past and present and those connected with Chatsworth. Facilities include darts, swimming, golf, tennis, bowls, drama, badminton, and cricket. Whilst bingo, whist drives, dances and cabaret evenings are held regularly. There is an active Women's Institute and the Royal British Legion both hold meetings at the club.
In Pilsley there is a village pub, and a village hall where Darby and Joan and Youth Club meetings are held. Guides, Scouts and Cub Scout meetings are held in the village school.
